channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024010667
item.description:
Report X-2024010667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages were loaded in the morning for delivery. Driver was unable to deliver because one of the hazmat packages started leaking and damaged 2 other hazmat packages. DescribePack: One of the 1 GAL containers had a loose cap and spilled internally. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote that was lined with hazmat bag to mitigate any further release.

item.title: Report E-2024010456
item.description:
Report E-2024010456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USD experienced a UN2031 Nitric Acid release from a 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to clean the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the drum lid due to loose bung caps. Contractors tightened the bungs and secured the drums for shipment on. The drum was wiped down and neutralized with sodium bicarb. The damaged impacted rags and PPE were collected and containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2024010471
item.description:
Report E-2024010471

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that a very small amount of UM Barr Klean-Strip Acetone (UN1090) was released from a cardboard box containing approximately 4 metal 1-gallon containers of product due to a forklift accident. The release impacted just the cardboard box it was shipped in. Terminal personnel cleaned up the spill using appropriate PPE provided by the terminal per the SDS. (they advised no absorbent was used - the small amount of liquid on the box evaporated/dried). 1 box- Containing cardboard box and (4) 1-gallon metal containers was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: RECEIVED A CALL FOR LEAKING PACKAGE FROM AN IRREG BELT. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT LOCATION WITH PROPER PPE, FOUND A WET HAZMAT PLASATIC CONTAINER ON THE BELT. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL FOLLOWING DECISION TREE/APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. BROUGHT CONTAINER BACK TO DMP AREA FOR FINAL PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024010397
item.description:
Report E-2024010397

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Due to leaking 1-gallon plastic bottles of (UN3264) SikaColor®-420 Chemstain® CS1 black, 1-gallon of product released onto the exterior cardboard-box packaging of (24) boxes that were palletized and shrink-wrapped together. The leaking bottles are either due to human error or improper packaging. In total, (96) 1-gallon bottles were impacting with hazardous product and containerized into (6) 55DF's for hazardous waste disposal. The packaging, pallet, and PPE were neutralized using Kolorsafe and containerized into (4) 55DF's for non-hazardous waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023121006
item.description:
Report X-2023121006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: EL SEGUNDO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/19/23, the CPDX 109139 was found with frosting on the protective housing on top of the car. El Segundo Fire and Chevron Fire responded to conduct air monitoring around the site and inspect the car. Upon inspection, liquid LPG was found coming from the liquid valve. The valve was partially open. Responders closed the valve which had stopped the leak. BNSF responders inspected the car and also determined that the liquid valve plug was less than tool tight. Air monitoring was conducted to verify integrity of repairs with pressure on the valve and plug.
